intro: Solanum mite subsp. hexazygum, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a member of the Solanaceae family. It is native to Central America and is characterized by its small, egg-shaped fruits that turn from green to yellow or red when mature. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow with purple veins, and it produces small, white berries that contain toxic alkaloids. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and research settings.
